text: The 1990 Campeonato Nacional, was the 58th season of top-flight football in Chile. Colo-Colo won its seventeenth title. Deportes Concepción, as Liguilla winners, also qualified for the next Copa Libertadores . ==League table== ==Results== ==Top goalscorers== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Rank ! Name ! Club ! Goals |- | align=center | 1 | Rubén Martínez |Colo-Colo |align=center| 22 |- | align=center | 2 | Gustavo De Luca |Deportes La Serena |align=center| 19 |- | align=center | 3 | Aníbal González |O'Higgins |align=center| 17 |- | align=center | 3 | Gerardo Reinoso |Universidad Católica |align=center| 17 |- | align=center | 5 | Juan González |Unión Española |align=center| 16 |- | align=center | 5 | Richard Zambrano |Unión Española |align=center| 16 |- | align=center | 7 | Adrián Czornomaz |Cobreloa |align=center| 14 |} Source ==Title== ==Liguilla Pre-Copa Libertadores== \---- \---- Deportes Concepción also qualified for the 1991 Copa Libertadores ==Promotion/Relegation Liguilla== \---- \---- Everton and Deportes Antofagasta (after Naval was dissolved); will play in the 1991 Primera División ==See also== *1990 Copa Apertura ==References== ==Sources== *RSSSF Page Category:Primera División de Chile seasons Chile Primera
title: 1990 Primera División de Chile
